vulnerability_findings.name: array-length-outside-loop
vulnerability_findings.message: Caching the array length outside a loop saves reading it on each iteration, as long as the array's length is not changed during the loop.

vulnerability_findings.name: array-length-outside-loop
vulnerability_findings.message: Caching the array length outside a loop saves reading it on each iteration, as long as the array's length is not changed during the loop.

vulnerability_findings.name: unnecessary-checked-arithmetic-in-loop
vulnerability_findings.message: A lot of times there is no risk that the loop counter can overflow. Using Solidity's unchecked block saves the overflow checks.

vulnerability_findings.name: unnecessary-checked-arithmetic-in-loop
vulnerability_findings.message: A lot of times there is no risk that the loop counter can overflow. Using Solidity's unchecked block saves the overflow checks.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-custom-error-not-require
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-custom-error-not-require
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-prefix-increment-not-postfix
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using the prefix increment expression whenever the return value is not needed. The prefix increment expression is cheaper in terms of gas.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-prefix-increment-not-postfix
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using the prefix increment expression whenever the return value is not needed. The prefix increment expression is cheaper in terms of gas.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-short-revert-string
vulnerability_findings.message: Shortening revert strings to fit in 32 bytes will decrease gas costs for deployment and  gas costs when the revert condition has been met.

vulnerability_findings.name: incorrect-use-of-blockhash
vulnerability_findings.message: blockhash(block.number) and blockhash(block.number + N) always returns 0.

vulnerability_findings.name: calls-loop
vulnerability_findings.message:
Multicall2.aggregate has external calls inside a loop:
	- (success,ret) = calls[i].target.call(calls[i].callData) (Multicall2.sol#25)

vulnerability_findings.name: calls-loop
vulnerability_findings.message:
Multicall2.tryAggregate has external calls inside a loop:
	- (success,ret) = calls[i].target.call(calls[i].callData) (Multicall2.sol#77)

vulnerability_findings.name: pragma
vulnerability_findings.message:
Different versions of Solidity is used in Multicall2.sol:
	- Version used: ['>=0.5.0', 'ABIEncoderV2']
	- Multicall2.sol#3 declares pragma solidity>=0.5.0
	- Multicall2.sol#4 declares pragma experimentalABIEncoderV2

vulnerability_findings.name: external-function
vulnerability_findings.message: Multicall2.aggregate (Multicall2.sol#21-29) should be declared external

vulnerability_findings.name: external-function
vulnerability_findings.message: Multicall2.blockAndAggregate (Multicall2.sol#31-40) should be declared external

vulnerability_findings.name: external-function
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code:
function getBlockHash(uint256 blockNumber) public view returns (bytes32 blockHash) {

    blockHash = blockhash(blockNumber);
vulnerability_findings.message: Multicall2.getBlockHash (Multicall2.sol#42-44) should be declared external

vulnerability_findings.name: SOLIDITY_SHOULD_RETURN_STRUCT
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: function aggregate(Call[] memory calls) public returns (uint256 blockNumber, bytes[] memory returnData) {

errors: exception (RuntimeError: Source map error, unknown name(SHR) or instr_name(INVALID))

vulnerability_findings.name: Exception State (SWC 110)
vulnerability_findings.message:
An assertion violation was triggered.
It is possible to trigger an assertion violation. Note that Solidity assert() statements should only be used to check invariants. Review the transaction trace generated for this issue and either make sure your program logic is correct, or use require() instead of assert() if your goal is to constrain user inputs or enforce preconditions. Remember to validate inputs from both callers (for instance, via passed arguments) and callees (for instance, via return values). This issue is reported for internal compiler generated code.
Classification: SWC-110
